questiontext.text:
Exercise

A target is made of three concentric circles of radii \(r_1 = \displaystyle{@a/sqrt(3)@}\), \(r_2 = {@a@}\) and \(r_3={@a*sqrt(3)@}\) metres. Shots within the inner circle count \({@s@}\) points, within the middle band \({@s-g@}\) points and within the outer band \({@s-2*g@}\) points. (Shots outside the target count zero.) The distance of a shot from the centre of the target is a random variable \(R\) with density function \(f(r) = \dfrac{{@b@}}{ \pi ({@c@}+r^2)}\) , \(r > 0\). Calculate the expected value of the score after five shots.

Expected value of the score after five shots: [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Solution

First we need to calculate the following probabilities:

\(\begin{aligned} P( \text{shot within inner circle}) & = P(0<r<{@a*1/sqrt(3)@}) = \displaystyle{\int_0^{{@a*1/sqrt(3)@}}} {@f(r)@} \; dx \\ &= \dfrac{2}{\pi} tan^{-1} (\dfrac{r}{{@a@}}) |_0^{{@a*1/sqrt(3)@}} = {@Pin@} \end{aligned}\)

\(\begin{aligned} P( \text{shot within middle band}) & = P({@a*1/sqrt(3)@}<r<{@a@}) = \displaystyle{\int_{{@a*1/sqrt(3)@}}^{{@a@}}} {@f(r)@} \; dx \\ & = \dfrac{2}{\pi} tan^{-1} (\dfrac{r}{{@a@}}) |_{{@a*1/sqrt(3)@}}^{{@a@}} = {@Pmid@} \end{aligned}\)

\(\begin{aligned} P( \text{shot within outer band}) & = P({@a@}<r<{@a*sqrt(3)@}) = \displaystyle{\int_{{@a@}}^{{@a*sqrt(3)@}}} {@f(r)@} \; dx\\ & = \dfrac{2}{\pi} tan^{-1} (\dfrac{r}{{@a@}}) |_{{@a@}}^{{@a@}\sqrt(3)} = {@Pout@} \end{aligned}\)

\(P( \text{miss target})= \displaystyle{1 - {@Pin@} - {@Pmid@} - {@Pout@} ={@Pmiss@}}.\)

Next, we define a random variable S according to the score obtained (our radnom space is \(\{{@s@}, {@s-g@}, {@s-2*g@}, 0 \}\)), i.e. 

\(P(S={@s@})=P( \text{shot within inner circle})=\displaystyle{{@Pin@}}\)

\(P(S={@s-g@})=P( \text{shot within middle band})=\displaystyle{{@Pmid@}}\)

\(P(S={@s-2*g@})=P( \text{shot within outer band})=\displaystyle{{@Pout@}}\)

\(P(S=0)=P( \text{miss target})=\displaystyle{{@Pmiss@}}.\)

Finally, we calculate the expected value of the score after five shots:

\(\begin{aligned} E[S+S+S+S+S] & = E[5S] = 5E[S] \\ & = \displaystyle 5 \left( {@s@}\cdot{@Pin@} +{@s-g@}\cdot {@Pmid@} + {@s-2*g@}\cdot{@Pout@} +0\cdot{@Pmiss@} \right) \\ &= 5\cdot{@E@} = {@ta1@}. \end{aligned}\)
